thread.title: Storm damage causes widespread outages in Ellsworth area | News | foxbangor.com
thread.title_full: Storm damage causes widespread outages in Ellsworth area | News | foxbangor.com

author: Grace Blanchard
title: Storm damage causes widespread outages in Ellsworth area | News | foxbangor.com
text:
ELLSWORTH -- Downed trees and poles knocked out power to one of the Ellsworth area's busiest strips, causing businesses and schools to shut down.
"We had some high winds obviously come through last night with the rain and it did snap a utility pole on high street," said Ellsworth Deputy Police Chief, Shawn Willey.
Along Route 1, damage from Wednesday night's storm left a trail of darkness, forcing Ellsworth schools and multiple businesses to close.
"I would say most of the places are still open, been in a couple places and they're dark but they're doing what we are, making the most of it, nobody can afford to close for the day so we're here for it," said Scott Polley, manager of the Ellsworth Napa Auto Parts.
While some were forced to close, many businesses did what they had to, to keep the doors open.
"A lot of the guys are wearing head lights, flash lights, we're using pen and paper instead of computers obviously but we're here for the customers bottom line," said Polley.
